titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Bernard Begley, Discharge
CWG9851

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Jefferson Circuit
v

Commonwealth Plff
Against On petition
Bernard Begley Deft

The defendant being solemnly called to appear in discharge of the recognizance entered into by him in this Court on the 23 day of July 1859 came not but made default It is therefore considered by the Court that the Clerk of this Court issue a writ of Scirifacias against the said Bernard Begley together with a L H Rousseau his bail returnable to the next term of the Court, to show cause if any they have or can. why the Commonwealth shall not have Judgment and Execution against them for the sum of Six hundred dollars each, according to the form and effect of said recognizance, And for a breach of the condition thereof. And on motion of the Commonwealth a Capias is awarded her against the said Begley returnable &c which Capias shall be endorsed bail of said Begley in the sum of $600 with security in a like sum conditioned &c, And all further proceedings are continued until next term,

A Copy
Att James P Chambers clk

Jefferson Cir. Ct
Commonwealth
vs } Recognizance
Bernard Begley
L. H Rousseau
Remission Issd
Jany 22d 1861
